title: Internet-Based Tinnitus Intervention
chief_complaint: I have distressing tinnitus in both ears that sounds like ringing, buzzing, low and high pitched sounds, pulsating, clicking, music, voices, and humming. It makes me grumpy and irritable, and I have trouble sleeping and concentrating.

problem_summary.course: Constant; attributed to long periods of noise exposure without protection.
problem_summary.associated_symptoms: Hyperacusis (loud noises are annoying/aggravating), mild hearing difficulty (phone/TV), insomnia, mild anxiety and depression.
problem_summary.functional_impact: Unable to do things previously enjoyed; trouble concentrating; irritability affecting mood.
problem_summary.goals_motivation: Struggling to hear but refuses hearing aids ('hates anything in his ears'). 100% committed to trying new strategies via internet intervention.

history.present_illness: Patient reports constant bilateral tinnitus for 2 years. Describes complex sounds (ringing, buzzing, pulsating, clicking, music, voices, humming).
history.otologic_history: Mild hearing loss reported (no hearing aids used). Strong hyperacusis present.
history.noise_exposure_history: Long periods of exposure to noise without adequate hearing protection.
history.medical_psych_history: Mild levels of anxiety and depression identified. Subthreshold insomnia.
history.prior_management: Initial therapy session provided explanations and sleep hygiene, but patient could not attend regular clinic visits due to working abroad.
history.patient_goals: To cope with tinnitus more effectively, understand it better, make it less annoying, relax more easily, and reduce tension.

tests.name: Self-report scales (Baseline)
tests.key_findings: Scores indicate moderate tinnitus impact, strong hyperacusis, and mild anxiety/depression.

history.present_illness: Patient completed 8 weeks of Internet-based CBT. He was very engaged, logged in regularly, and completed relevant modules.
history.prior_management: Completed modules on understanding tinnitus, relaxation, reinterpreting tinnitus, positive imagery, and sleep guidelines.
history.patient_goals: Felt he had enough strategies to cope and did not require further help.

tests.name: Self-report scales (Post-intervention)
tests.key_findings: Significant reduction in tinnitus severity, hyperacusis, and associated psychological distress. THI screening scores showed a gradual decline over the 8 weeks.

history.present_illness: 1-year follow-up. Patient continued to use CBT tools (relaxation, shifting focus) during daily life.

tests.name: Self-report scales (1-year Follow-up)
tests.key_findings: Improvements were maintained or further improved one year later without further intervention.

overall_audiologic_summary: The patient presented with constant bilateral tinnitus, strong hyperacusis, and mild hearing loss (though he refused amplification). Baseline assessment revealed moderate tinnitus handicap and mild anxiety/depression. Following an 8-week Internet-based CBT intervention, he demonstrated significant improvements across all domains, including tinnitus severity, hyperacusis, and insomnia. These gains were maintained or further improved at the 1-year follow-up.
counseling_points: Tinnitus is often linked to noise exposure; protecting your residual hearing is vital.
While you dislike hearing aids, treating the hearing loss often reduces the contrast of the tinnitus.
Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) does not 'cure' the sound but helps rewire how your brain reacts to it, reducing distress.
Sleep hygiene and relaxation techniques are critical tools for managing tinnitus spikes.
Since you travel frequently, an internet-based program allows you to access modules and support on your own schedule.
notes_for_actor: Portray a patient who is initially grumpy and irritable due to lack of sleep and constant noise.
You are resistant to hearing aids ('I hate things in my ears') but very open to trying other therapies.
You travel for work and cannot attend weekly in-person appointments.
Show high motivation ('100% committed') once the internet-based plan is offered.
